dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.enterprise.risk.sec.evt.DHCPSecurityEvent
dataStructure.description:
DHCP events are structured to allow network defenders to track a given machine, by Media Access Control (MAC) address to an Internet Protocol (IP) address. Noting that DHCP IP addresses assign an IP address to a given MAC address for a specified lease period, the DHCP event tracks these elements.

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: DHCPSecurityEvent

child.name: clientMACAddress
child.description:
The Media Access Control (MAC) address that was assigned an IP address during this DHCP event.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is mandatory

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: clientMACAddress

child.name: leaseDuration
child.description:
The time duration that the IP address has been assigned to the MAC address for.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: leaseDuration

child.name: ipAddress
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is unique

This association end is an end of association IPAddressAssigned

This association end is optional
child.label: ipAddress
